subject: Basketball
Automobiles
Speed Limits and Speeding
lead_paragraph: The Phoenix Suns suspended Jason Richardson for one game without pay after he was clocked by the police in Scottsdale, Ariz., driving 55 miles per hour above the limit with his unrestrained 3-year-old son in the car. In a statement, the Suns said Richardson would miss Tuesday night’s home game against the Los Angeles Clippers “for conduct detrimental to the team.” The police said an officer saw Richardson driving 67 m.p.h. in a 40 m.p.h. zone Sunday night, followed him and clocked him at 90 m.p.h. in a 35 m.p.h. zone and pulled him over. The officer saw Richardson’s son in the back seat of the car and that he was not in a child seat.
